sub_title: Beleidsadviseur Waterkwantiteit at Waterschap Vallei en Veluwe
summary:
Arnoud Keizer is a water management specialist and has a master degree in water management. He has expertise on integrated water resource management topics, such as drinking water supply, floods and drought assessments, hydrology, river restoration and climate smart interventions related to agricultural production. Advising on and implementation of small-scale water buffer solutions is one of his main fields of expertise. He uses his mapping skills to communicate project results on watershed level.

He has working experience in South American, African and Asian countries, with most recent experiences in Brazil, Tanzania and Bangladesh. For Aidenvironment he performs water balance assessments, including climate change and socio-economic scenarios, advising clients (NGO’s, companies and governments) on environmentally sustainable and responsible use of water resources. Majority of these assessment are done in the context (preparation, guidance, review) of Environmental Social Impact Assessment (ESIA), because many programs impact local water resources. 
Arnoud is experienced in setting up and facilitating training programs to capacitate organisations in integrated water resource management (IWRM), water security, Disaster Risk Reduction planning and GIS mapping. He sees thinking along watershed boundaries and development and support of local water governance structures as one of the important solutions to the world-wide water challenges of the 21st century. 
Previously he worked for seven years for Royal HaskoningDHV as a project manager/engineer specializing in hydrological model simulations and river basin management option design, implementation and water resources monitoring. In his previous job, he completed several assignments for local water authorities.

treasury_media.title: Aidenvironment and partners Thinking With The Landscape
treasury_media.description: A joint initiative of Aidenvironment (RAIN Foundation), Wetlands International and Joint Effort to Save the Environment restored the hilly landscape of Rwambu in Uganda. The project demonstrates how wetland restoration and water buffering interventions in the micro catchment can be integrated to sustain water supply for multiple sectors (WASH, agriculture). The approach and results of this project illustrate my work at Aidenvironment.

treasury_media.title: Disaster prevention in the Phillippines - EU Aid Volunteers
treasury_media.description: EU Aid Volunteers is an initiative developed by the European Union's Humanitarian Office, DG ECHO. With VSO's participation, the initiative supports the EU's humanitarian efforts in disaster preparedness and risk reduction, and by enhancing the link between relief, rehabilitation and development.

profile_positions.description: Aidenvironment is a values driven consultancy providing services and research in sustainable production and trade. As a hydrologist/consultant in land & water management I advise clients on the interaction between ecosystems, agriculture, land use and water resources in an area. My role is to develop water management solutions at community and at catchment level. From a hydrological perspective I work on water availability and demand studies, including the application technologies increasing the water buffer capacity of the landscape. We advise clients how to manage and use land and water resources efficiently and effectively.

profile_positions.description: The Disaster Risk and Exposure Assessment for Mitigation (DREAM) program aims to produce detailed and high-resolution flood hazard maps for the critical river basins in the Philippines. By doing this disaster preparedness of the national and regional governments can be improved. As an EU-Aid volunteer send by VSO The Netherlands I help the DREAM program with the implementation of monitoring and evaluation tasks and with the improvement of current project management processes and skills. I also advise the organisation on specific flood modelling issues.
